course.subject: LANG
course.name: Technical Communication II for CSE, CPEG & DSCT
course.description: A one-term, major-specific language course for CSE students, and for CPEG and DSCT students undertaking a CSE Final Year Project or Final Year Thesis. The course focuses on report writing and presentations, and communication in professional contexts relevant to the disciplines.
course.prerequisites: (For DDP only) CORE 1403 OR CORE 1404 OR LANG 1003 (prior to 2022-23); (For DSCT only) LANG 2010 OR LANG 2030; (For all others) LANG 2030
course.corequisites: (For COMP and DSCT) COMP 4910 OR COMP 4981 OR COMP 4981H ; (For CPEG) CPEG 4901 OR CPEG 4902 OR CPEG 4910; (For COSC) Nil

reviews.author: B.T.
reviews.title: A complete waste of time
reviews.comment_content:
1. Interim Report (25%) - supposed to help your fyp. However, it covers introduction and literature review after your actual FYP proposal was due. So how can it help? Well, if it is supposed to help the Progress Report, then how may I write the details just one month after fall semester kicks off??? Stupid and ridiculous af.

Yet, this is not the most trashy stuff.
2. Poster Present (25%) - supposed to prepare us for the presentation in late April. However, CSE has changed the present style to video since Covid, no more poster. Nvm, still fine, the most weird point is how may I make up the stuff that I havenâ€™t worked yet to present?

Anyway, this is still not the worst part.
3. Mobile App Review (20%)
4. User Guide (20%)
Well, whatâ€™s the point for adding these two in a FYP Lang course?
Apart from filling up the contents for full 13 weeks, I canâ€™t see any. App review is stupid, you need to make a picture-in-picture video, and I donâ€™t really see there is a relationship with CSE. User guide is probably the most nonsense stuff, teaching audiences to use a website which is in turn helping CLE to promote their rubbish websites.

Assignment Checkpoints (10%) - used to replace attendance. But imo its even worse than having attendance score. At least attendance can save some lives.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is so bad. Rosita is not the worst tutor and she speaks clearly with energy and she is okish engaging.

However, the overall teaching for this course is a complete disaster. The tasks lack coherence in between. Unclear guidelines and rubrics. Not following the CSE department standard. Even worse, there was not enough time to cover User Guide in my class due to typhoon (but the typhoon hit one month ago). And the tutor just rushed everything towards the end, while occasionally she ends the class half hour in advance, showing she lacks time management skills.

There was also no clear instructions on what being expected on assignment checkpoints and the schedules have flaws. Idk why, but our class skipped assignment checkpoint 3 without any prior notice. Nonsense.
reviews.comment_grading:
Super poor grading.

First of all, fyr I am a ddp student. I took 6 Lang + Labu courses in total. I got A- in every single lang course even including chinese lang.

Anyway, I got a B in Lang4030, only here but not in others. I got A- in Lang1003, A- in Lang2030, A- in Labu2040, A- in Labu2060, A- in Lang1117P.

Therefore, I doubt whether it is my problem or the problems of this tutor and CLE that my grade dropped drastically from a consistent A- to B.

Indeed, almost in all of my assignments, I got â€œgoodâ€ band in the rubrics.

Interim Report: 5 / 5.5 / 5.5 / 5.5
Poster Present: 5 / 5.5 / 5.5
Mobile App Review: 5 / 5 / 5
User Guide: 5 / 5 / 5.5 / 5

Yes, a whole bunch of 5 and 5.5
Moreover, the released comments do not really match with my work. I wonder if my tutor has graded them seriously or just randomly give out some 5 and some 5.5 then next.

I attended all classes although attendance was not taken. I am not sure about my assignment checkpoints score as it is quite messy on Canvas but I guess it should be full.

Final letter grade: B

Super bad.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is huge af, and most importantly, none of then is useful.

For your reference, the interim report is due AFTER the actual fyp proposal, so you cant use it to help. Moreover, you have to make a poster out from nowhere (poster is supposed for an end-of-project presentation but given it is in Fall term you can only â€œmake upâ€ your work)

Interim report and poster present are both due in week 7, during the week where most of the other midterms are held. And I have to spent my precious time working on these nonsense stuff amid being busy in the midterm week, in return for poor gradings.

Then, a useless app review where you need to make a video-in-video presentation that I spent hours making the technical stuff even I have finished filming early. My macbook literally dies when I was making it.

The user guide is a bit lighter, but anyway, these two garbage tasks are due in week 13, where your other final projects / exams are due. You will have to suffer a lot with this course.

However, you have to take it. Therefore, when my tutor and/or SFQ asked me how may this course improve, apologies, there is nothing to improve, please just shut this course down and donâ€™t ever waste final year studentsâ€™ precious time again. There is no fucking use in the entire course. If one doesnâ€™t know how to write FYP report, this course canâ€™t help due to its loose structure and not following the CSE requirements tightly; If one already knows how to write FYP report, this course for sure wonâ€™t help.

Everyone knows how to search for â€œhow to write a reportâ€ on Google. Conclusion: LANG4030 has no use.

reviews.title: Mostly useless
reviews.comment_content:
Two topics with four components in total:

Topic 1 : FYP
1.1. Interim report
1.2. Poster presentation

Topic 2 : Workplace communication
2.1. App review
2.2. User guide

Mostly useless. The only useful component probably is the FYP interim report. At least it vaguely gives you some idea on your real FYP progress report. However, the requirements, standards , structure and style are not totally the same. You need to write a "LANG style" interim report. That is, merely focusing on language requirement (fancy words, sentence structure) rather than the integrity of your ideas. Therefore, it can only gives you a vague taste of the real FYP report.

At the time you start writing the interim report, you should have submitted your proposal report. As a result, very likely you only need to modify, paraphrase and shorten your proposal report and then done. For my group we write over 9000 words in the proposal report and we need to shorten it to around 1500 words, which is painful

For other components I just cannot figure out their reason for existence = =

Since this is my last LANG course, maybe let me talk a little bit more. I just hate CLE ruining the objective of each assessment with their trash rubrics. When students are doing an assessment task, they only need to treat the rubrics as a kind of checklist or shopping list. Then, put all the things CLE want into their submission, boxing it with some fancy words or sentence structures. Lastly, submit it and pray for the instructor is not a killer. Is this mechanical assessment style effective to let student learn language? I am doubted about that. At least I learn nearly nothing throughout every LANG course I enrolled in UST. Then CLE why do you force us to enroll these meaningless course? Just for torturing us?
reviews.comment_teaching:
Angie's teaching is fine, not superior though. I can see that she has the heart to teach. In the lecture she tries not to reading from the textbook merely. She keeps reminding us the key points or traps of the assessment tasks. She is also willing to answer our questions or give advice on assessment tasks after class. These are good.

However, she likes to see us talking. Every lecture she divides us into teams and holds many discussion sessions (Nearly half of the lecture will be discussion time). Well, as you know IT people are likely introverts. As a result, people are not very willing to talk, talk random irrelevant things, or even just let dead air occurs, which is a little bit embarrassing. I know she wants us to talk more because it is essential in language learning. However, being one of the introverts, I still don't like this teaching style very much personally...

Another problem is that she gives feedback and score so slowly. It takes a long time to receive my Topic 1 assessment feedback and results. At the time this comment comes out, I still haven't received my result on Topic 2 assessments. Very probably she just wants to skip them and gives me the letter grade directly...

When we ask for feedback, she always claims that she is busy. Come on Angie, is there a person in UST not busy?

(Update 5/2/2023)
Well I know my grade now. However, Angie didn't release the score of assessment 2 from beginning to the end. Likely one month ago I sent her an email to request the score. However, she didn't reply. I think that is a little bit irresponsible...
reviews.comment_grading:
Not very good in terms of number score. She tends to give 5. If you want to get a 6 or even 7, you really need to put effort and try to impress her.

From what she said in class:
Overall 6 = A
Some 5s and some 6s = B+ or A-
Overall 5 = B- or B

Since these comes from her mouth, I think they are somehow reliable. However, it is up to you to judge whether it is good, fair or bad grade.

Grade distribution and my score:
Topic 1 : FYP
1.1. Interim report (25%) : 5.5 6 6 6
1.2. Poster presentation (25%) : 5 5 5

Topic 2 : Workplace communication
2.1. App review (20%) : Unknown
2.2. User guide (20%) : Unknown

Assessment tasks checkpoint (10%) : Full marks

Grade : A-

I know my grade, but I still don't know what is my performance in assessment 2, well...
reviews.comment_workload:
2 writing + 2 speaking. Regular LANG workload. But it may be a problem for final year CSE students who has FYP and bunch of difficult course to deal with.

If you are doing FYP, you are going to do the interim report together. Each person will only need to write around 300-400 words. For poster presentation, you can design the poster together (Presentation part is still individual though). On the other hand, it may takes longer time in app review because you also need to do video editing, which is troublesome. However, overall I think it is still barely acceptable.

Also, there are 4 assessment tasks checkpoint which helps you to brainstorm or check whether you are on the right track. They are mainly held during the lecture and can be finished in a short time. Therefore, just don't escape class then you will be fine.

reviews.author: DrainGang
reviews.title: Waste of time
reviews.comment_content:
Meaningless.

As the fourth and final LANG course (excluding Chinese LANG courses) you would take in your UST life, it also is the worst one.

Similar to previous LANG courses, the course is split into 2 halves, for the first half you write an interim report, which will the only relatively useful thing you do out of the entire course as you can reuse quite a good chunk of that for your actual FYP interim report.

Other than that the course attempts to teach you: how to do your FYP poster (which you don't actually need to do for your FYP anymore), how to write a user guide (you have probably read thousands of them by now so you don't learn anything writing one) and how to review an app (has no relation to your FYP or degree as a whole), so this course is simply a waste of time preventing you from working on your FYP.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Maisie (Avoid her like your life depends on this)

Given the content of this course, there's really nothing the lectures can do to save it, however she does try, the effort is commendable at the very least.

She gives a lot of discussion time (unmarked) between students, following the textbook to a tee, however the discussions are often pretty menial and go nowhere as everyone in the course is aware it's not important, other than the interim report where you can ask for some advice, the lectures are a waste of time.

Adding here that grading of the papers and presentations took a staggeringly long time (over a month), and the writing you do on CANVAS will also receive no feedback, so if you aim to improve your English, look elsewhere, which should be obvious by now.
reviews.comment_grading:
Poor.

Everyone in my session gets the same grade no matter the performance, which is around (5, 5, 5).

Got an A from LANG2030H, and B- on this, so I'm quite certain Maisie doesn't know how to grade students, again, avoid her like the plague.
reviews.comment_workload:
Lighter than the other LANG courses, but since you take this along with your FYP, it takes up more time that it should.

For the interim report, you write 1500 words or so, but the work is shared between your FYP group, so you may end up writing as few as 300-400 words.

As for the presentations they are mostly around 800-1000 words if you plan on writing a script, so it's not too difficult. The user review is 700-1000 words, but since you are just mostly describing actions, it's also pretty easy.

For the app review video, recording will take some time as you should aim for no mistakes in one take, editing the video will also take a while.

reviews.author: sleepingbag
reviews.comment_content:
In the first half of the course, we focused on writing the interim report (proposal) and presentation. In the second half, we had things different from FYP such as App Review and User Guide.

From my perspective, engineering students seldom have a chance to practice English or speak publicly, Lang courses provide many chances for engineering students to practice speaking English in front of audiences and convey their points of view. Therefore I don't think we should judge the content based on how useful it is. If you try to speak more in the class, of course the more you will learn in the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Maisie is fantastic and passionate about teaching. She also explains some tips for the report in detail and often mentions about how we could improve. Most importantly, she is gorgeous.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is quite tricky in every Lang course. You will receive levels such as "Good", "Very Good", and "Excellent"... for each dimension of the language skill in each assignment.

From my experience, the mapping is similar to the following:
Good -> B+
Very Good -> A-
Excellent -> A- to A

Note that Good is not the lowest level and excellent is not the highest level, and this mapping is just my personal guess, please don't take it too seriously.

Though a letter grade is eventually the grade we will receive, I think it is better to understand why we get such a level grade on each language skill.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload in the first two assignments is lite because they are the things that you will work on for the FYP. App review and User Guide also wouldn't take too much time. But if you compare the amount of workload to other courses with just a few assignments, of course, this course requires a bit more workload.

reviews.author: SmartBee
reviews.title: An Easy A but a Frustrating Class
reviews.comment_content:
Not a very interesting class for students who have a high or fluent level of English.
However some aspects are useful if you take the course during the Fall semester (instead of spring) as it forces you to start writing and thinking about your FYP.

However, it is important to note that the FYP content that you write for this LANG class does not match the content you must write for the FYP.
Key difference: LANG class focuses more on the business (sellable) aspect whereas the COMP FYP requires you to focus more on the technical aspect.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ka is an okay professor, he tried to get students to participate as much as possible and does try his best to make the boring syllabus more interesting.
reviews.comment_grading:
As English is my mother tongue, I got an A.
However, they do put more emphasis on HOW you analyze instead of your actual vocabulary and fluidity of speech.

2 Assignments - each assignment is divided into an oral part and a written part.

They do not use percentage grades.
But I got mostly Excellent on the 1st Assignment and got Very Good on the 2nd.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too much workload.

The oral presentations do not take too much prior preparation and the 1st written assignment can be shared amongst FYP members.

reviews.author: Trang
reviews.comment_content: LANG 4030 is a three-credit course offered to final year Computer Science & Engineering (CSE) students who are taking a Final Year Project (FYP). Over one semester, students will attend three hours of class and will be expected to complete up to six hours of out-of-class work, per week. The course focuses on two areas: Communication skills for CSE projects and Communication in Professional Contexts
reviews.comment_teaching: There is no attendant requirement for the online class, and the instructor just instructed students to handle the assignments.
reviews.comment_workload:
FYP interim report (group or individual) 25%
FYP poster presentation (group or individual) 25%
Software user guide (individual) 20%
Mobile app review video (individual) 20%
Assignment checkpoints# (individual) 10%

The workload is quite light, you can do it in advance by yourself. There are sufficient requirements and guidelines for the textbook. The Interim report and poster FYP overlap with FYP, so they reduced a lot of time.

Take care of assignment checkpoints, there are 4 checkpoints before each assignment. Students wrote a part of the assignment and receive feedback from the instructor. Good luck and take it easy :))

reviews.author: que220
reviews.comment_content:
This course is for all CSE students and for all CPEG students undertaking a CSE Final Year Project.
tutor will guide through you how to write Final Year Project  report
like a normal lang course content
a normal class is like 20 students
reviews.comment_teaching:
you have to buy the lang textbook and tutor just followed it to teach you
divided into 2 parts: 1 is for FYP and the second part is for user guide
reviews.comment_grading:
It is a 3-credit lang course
I don't know the grade yet, feel like mean of lang course is B
but the instructot is nice and gives you many feedback, so in regardless of the grade, in general it is a good course
reviews.comment_workload:
2 written assignments, one is for fyp report
2 oral presentations, like 8-10 mins

reviews.author: gossipgirl
reviews.comment_content:
Half of the content is FYP related
Other half is general CS writing related
Obviously, not difficult.
reviews.comment_teaching: Not too much to comment on. Mostly follows book with some exercises in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grade.
Participate in class to get full points there. 10%
Do know that grading is done together for all students enrolled in 4030. So, your instructor doesn't have too much control over your letter grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. Shouldn't take more than 10-12 hours of your time during the whole semester for the entire course. (excluding classes)
